attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently I submited a petition calling for the PM to resign over the governments failure to address the housing shortage (short name: "pm-must-resign"). However, it was rejected because it was "similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions". When I followed the link to look at the supposedly similar petition, I found it was not even remotely similar as it said nothing about asking the PM to resign.

Either the people who are employed to check the e-petitions are too stupid to read, or they are deliberately rejecting the petitions they don't like.

Freedom of speech is fundamental to democracy - censorship of legitimate opinions cannot be allowed.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
